definition: to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai forced emperor to abdicate and hand over power to him.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱逼迫皇帝遜位，把政權交給了他。

sentences.english: That's forced the guys to be better boyfriends in turn.
sentences.chinese: 這逼迫了男人們成爲了更好的男朋友。

sentences.english: Yang Wei design brings Wang Xu to the factory press foam appear, on the spot humiliate foam.
sentences.chinese: 楊偉設計引王旭到工廠逼迫沫兒出現，當場羞辱沫兒。

sentences.english: Many people were locked up - sometimes even killed or driven to suicide.
sentences.chinese: 許多人被關押，有時甚至被殺害，或者逼迫自殺。

sentences.english: And when the dragon saw that he was cast to the earth, he persecuted the woman who brought forth the man-child.
sentences.chinese: 龍見自己被摔在地上，就逼迫那生男孩子的婦人。

sentences.english: Forceyour opponent to come on land with his Stingrays whenever possible.
sentences.chinese: 在可能的時候逼迫你的敵人把黃貂魚趕到岸上來。

sentences.english: Children are sometimes forced to beg by their own relatives.
sentences.chinese: 有些兒童甚至被他們的親戚逼迫行乞。

sentences.english: He pressed all of the adult males into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 他逼迫所有成年男性爲奴。

sentences.english: So in one way, you are forcing people to work even if they can't," Voss said.
sentences.chinese: 這麼說來，這是在逼迫已經不能工作的人繼續工作。

sentences.english: The meeting also resolved to keep up the pressure for Colonel Qaddafi to quit.
sentences.chinese: 會議也決定了要繼續向卡扎非施加壓力，逼迫其下臺。

sentences.english: The government and your teachers forced you to read them.
sentences.chinese: 政府和你的老師們逼迫你去讀它們。

sentences.english: Year in October, immediately forced the Han Xiandi abdicate the throne, self-reliance for the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 當年十月，立刻逼迫漢獻帝禪位，自立爲皇帝。

sentences.english: Any forced or coerced movement of people is completely unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 任何強行逼迫災民返回的作法都是不能接受的。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold in flower bigfoot under persecution finally with the couple.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金在花大腳的逼迫之下終於跟其成婚。

sentences.english: The peasants were constrained by the harsh laws of the Qin Dynasty and staged an uprising.
sentences.chinese: 在秦朝的苛法逼迫下，終於發生了農民起義。

sentences.english: Europeans shad previously captured Squanto and forced him into slavery.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲人早前就俘虜了斯匡託，逼迫他成爲奴隸。

definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
constrained/restricted/forced to/under pressure to do sth
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
